Posts.Content: Nicole_Bronx wrote: Hello! As many of you probably already know from another post of mine, my mother had her lumpectomy this past tuesday May 19th.  She is currently on bed rest for the next 7 days until we see her surgical team/oncologist and any one else involved in this process, on the 29th.   Any ideas on what she may like us to do for her, entertainment wise....i mean, she's already sick of just lying in bed all day and wants to get up and about.  of course i "forbid" her to lol!  i know what she will enjoy (watching movies, maybe a few books to read, puzzle books etc) but was there n e thing that you may have done, or someone did for you (or even looking back something u wish was done) that you can suggest i do for her to make the time pass or just lift her spirits when she seems to get down?? Thanks!!! xoxo! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Any Ideas??? Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: Nicole_Bronx wrote: Just want to thank those who have responded to some of my previous posts, and I hope to get thru this and perhaps help others as u have helped me   Going to see the surgeon today, she was just diagnosed about a week and a half ago.  I see some posts that show women not needing chemo...were your stats anywhere near these?  Her 2/new assay: Staining score 3+ Overexpression assessment: positive Estrogen receptor: 50% of cells with nuclear staining, weak to moderate intensity Infiltrating duct carcinoma, poorly differentiated grade 3 (this frightens me :-() I suppose I'm just looking for that glimmer of hope, I have kept my spirits us thus far and actually seeing these results have brought me down...hope the visit w/ the surgeon goes okay... Update: May 19th was going to be her date for surgery, but the Dr. had her do another mammogram b/c the prints we gave her from the other doctor did not reveal all that she suspected to see based on the printed report.  After being treated like a "science project" all day they came up w/ what may be other cancerous "calcifications??" (i wasnt at the doc w/ her that day, sick in bed all day) which will make it impossible to just do a lumpectomy (6cm from 2cm) so now they r talking mastectomy which means her surgery will have to be moved!!!  What is going on??? Tomorrow I am going w/ her to do her MRI and see if those "extra lumps" are indeed cancerous...wish us luck!  Update: 5/16/09: sooo the MRI is not a test used to see if cell are cancerous??? The doctor did not look at her MRI scans, however we were told by her asst that MRI was used to gauge how much area these "calcifications" covered.  When the doctor sees the scans, she will determine whether she should have a mastectomy...soooo we r still on for surgery May 19th for lumpectomy and they will also perform a surgical biopsy on the "calcifications", UNLESS the doctor sees something she doesnt like in the scans, surgery will be for mastectomy and will be rescheduled...PLEASE pray for the lumpectomy to take place as scheduled AND CLEAR MARGINS and LYMPH NODES!!!!  ::sigh:: what a journey... On a Positive note, my mom and I will be going the the CLUB tonite!!! lol! We will dance the night away :-) Log in to post a reply
